intro: Trichera communis, commonly known as the common trichera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Trichera communis is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil conditions.
